title: Explaining LSTM predictions for model using Dropout as a Bayesian Approximation

labels.name: todo
labels.description: This issue had an outstanding action to take.

body:
what i am trying to do is implement this  https://arxiv.org/pdf/1506.02142.pdf model and also want (shap.DeepExplainer) SHAP explanation i am getting

AssertionError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-32-7b7b3034f5be> in <module>
----> 1 shap_values = e.shap_values(np.array([X_test[-1]]))

~/anaconda3/envs/hosh_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/__init__.py in shap_values(self, X, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order)
    117         were chosen as "top".
    118         """
--> 119         return self.explainer.shap_values(X, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order)

~/anaconda3/envs/hosh_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep/deep_tf.py in shap_values(self, X, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order, check_additivity)
    283             for l in range(len(X)):
    284                 diffs = model_output[:, l] - self.expected_value[l] - output_phis[l].sum(axis=tuple(range(1, output_phis[l].ndim)))
--> 285                 assert np.abs(diffs).max() < 1e-4, "Explanations do not sum up to the model's output! Please post as a github issue."
    286         if not self.multi_output:
    287             return output_phis[0]

AssertionError: Explanations do not sum up to the model's output! Please post as a github issue.

my code is works without dropout layer
